intro: Pentameris capensis, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Pentameris capensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
